qas.question: Are all algae different from land plants?
What algae is the ancestor of true plants?
Are all species of algae similar?
To what species of algae is Charophyta related?

context: The algae are a polyphyletic group and are placed in various divisions, <a0_0>some more closely related<a0_0/> to plants than others. There are <a2_0>many differences<a2_0/> between them in features such as cell wall composition, biochemistry, pigmentation, chloroplast structure and nutrient reserves. The algal division <a1_0>Charophyta<a1_0/>, sister to the green algal division <a3_0>Chlorophyta<a3_0/>, is considered to contain the ancestor of true plants. The Charophyte class Charophyceae and the land plant sub-kingdom Embryophyta together form the monophyletic group or clade Streptophytina.
